MajorClaims.MC1: I personally disagree with this notion that these types of communication, telephones and email, made people less personal
MajorClaims.MC2: telephones and email do not make communication between people less personal

Claims.C1: Communication between people by using telephones and email made my life easier
Claims.C2: telephones and email help people, who live far away from other people, to connect each other
Claims.C3: using telephones and email could express some important words better than face-to-face communication
Claims.C4: Telephones and email make me feel personal

Premises.P1: Unlike email, send message by using mail service could be lost and could be sent to wrong address
Premises.P2: I can using telephones and email to talk or write directly to people I want to connect with
Premises.P3: I can make a phone call or write email to my parents whenever I want
Premises.P4: It is not possible to have conversation in person with my parents, who live in my country
Premises.P5: Telephones and email made me feel close to my parents
Premises.P6: sometime when I argue with my friends, I cannot express my self to my friends at that moment
Premises.P7: when I have a time to realize what had happened, I could explain the real thought that I want to express without emotion
Premises.P8: these types of communications make me feel personal
Premises.P9: I could directly connect with people that I love
Premises.P10: I could express my personal thought through telephones and email
